sorular.soru: What happens to the braking distance when you double your speed?
cevaplar: Braking distance becomes four times longer.
Braking distance becomes two times longer.
sorular.dogruCevap: Braking distance becomes four times longer.

feedback.metin: The braking distance depends on the speed at which you are driving. If you increase your speed, the braking distance becomes longer. If you double your speed, the braking distance becomes four times longer.

sorular.soru: The car and trailer have a total length of 12 metres. Are you allowed to enter this road?

feedback.metin: Sign C-17 means: No entry for vehicles and vehicle combinations that, including the load, are longer than indicated on the sign. In this case, that is 10 metres. A passenger car with a trailer, including the load, may never exceed 18 metres in length.

sorular.soru: How can you drive in an energy-efficient way?
cevaplar: Avoid frequent gear shifting and braking.
Turn off the engine as little as possible.
sorular.dogruCevap: Avoid frequent gear shifting and braking.

feedback.metin: Starting without accelerating, driving off in a composed manner and changing gears in good time are the most important points for energy-efficient driving. By looking far ahead, you are not required to brake and pull up all the time. As a result, you drive more energy efficiently. The use of cruise control ensures less energy consumption because you drive more constantly.

sorular.soru: What is the maximum allowed speed for a car with a trailer on an autoweg outside a built-up area?

feedback.metin: On both autowegen and motorways outside built-up areas, cars with trailers have a maximum allowed speed of 90 km/h unless signage indicates a lower speed limit.

sorular.soru: What kind of traffic behaviour is expected of you here in the bend?
cevaplar: You keep driving next to the lorry.
You keep driving behind the lorry.
sorular.dogruCevap: You keep driving behind the lorry.

feedback.metin: Larger vehicles, such as lorries and buses, require more space than passenger cars when cornering. This should be taken into account when cornering with several lanes. In this situation, the lorry in the bend may need some of your lane. So make sure that you do not drive right next to the lorry in such a curve, but stay behind it.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to overtake the lorry via the lane you are driving on?

feedback.metin: If you are on the right-hand side of a block marking, you may overtake traffic on the left-hand side of the block marking. Keep in mind that the lorry driver may choose to change lanes. Only overtake if it is safe and useful to do so.

sorular.soru: Are you positioned properly?
cevaplar: Only if there are no oncoming cyclists or moped riders.

feedback.metin: You are blocking a cycle path, which is prohibited. You need to position yourself further back.

sorular.soru: Is it allowed for the wheels to protrude from the width of the car?
cevaplar: Yes. With a maximum of 3 centimetres.
Yes. With a maximum of 6 centimetres.
sorular.dogruCevap: Yes. With a maximum of 3 centimetres.

feedback.metin: Wheels may protrude a maximum of 3 centimetres in width from the vehicle. In addition, they must be well shielded and must not rub.

sorular.soru: Can the police confiscate your driving licence if you are stopped because you have exceeded the speed limit by more than 50 km/h?

feedback.metin: If you have exceeded the speed limit by more than 50 km/h and are pulled over for doing so, the police must take your driving licence. Your driving licence will be sent to the public prosecutor's office together with the police report. The public prosecutor will then decide on further action.

sorular.soru: Should you give right of way to the cyclist?

feedback.metin: The cyclist is on the same road heading straight on and therefore has right of way. Although the cycle path is not directly parallel to the road, it is still part of the road.

sorular.soru: How do you adjust the headrest correctly?
cevaplar: The bottom of the support should be at shoulder level.
The top of the support should be equal to the top of your head.
The bottom of the support should be at the height of your ears.
sorular.dogruCevap: The top of the support should be equal to the top of your head.

feedback.metin: To prevent or limit injuries in the event of a collision, there are several safety features, including headrests. It is important that these are properly adjusted. The headrest should be as close as possible to the head, with the top of the support at the same height as the top of the head.

sorular.soru: After which sign Should you take into account children playing?

feedback.metin: Both signs warn you of children playing. The G-5 sign indicates an erf, where you can expect children playing on the carriageway. The sign J-21 indicates children who may cross the road unexpectedly. This sign is often seen near playgrounds and schools.

sorular.soru: Your brakes are not properly working. Are you allowed to drive to the garage to get it fixed?

feedback.metin: Your brakes should always work well. Without good working brakes you are not allowed to drive. Not even to the garage. That is life-threatening.

sorular.soru: Can you overtake the driver in front of you on the right?

feedback.metin: Overtaking on the right in traffic jams is allowed. You can also overtake on the right if you are on the right-hand side of a block marking and if the vehicle you are overtaking is pre-sorted for and indicating a left turn. However, you may not drive on the hard shoulder at any time. In this case, you cannot overtake on the right, and you must wait until the driver in front of you has found a place in the traffic jam.

sorular.soru: Can you use full-beam headlights here?
cevaplar: No, this will hinder the pedestrian.
sorular.dogruCevap: No, this will hinder the pedestrian.

feedback.metin: You are only allowed to use full-beam headlights at night, except in case of oncoming traffic or following another vehicle at a short distance.

sorular.soru: Are snorfiets riders allowed to ride next to each other?
cevaplar: No. But they are allowed to ride next to a cyclist.

feedback.metin: Snorfiets riders and moped riders are not allowed to ride next to each other. Nor are they allowed to ride next to a cyclist. Only cyclists are allowed to ride next to each other.

sorular.soru: Can you pick up a passenger here?

feedback.metin: Stopping or parking on a cycle lane is prohibited. However, there are no bicycle symbols on this lane, so it is a suggested cycle lane, rather than a cycle lane. This has no legal implications so you may stop or park on this lane, and you may also pick up and drop off passengers.

sorular.soru: What should you do if this warning light is on?
cevaplar: Keep driving until you can safely stop and call the garage or breakdown service.
Keep driving and report the malfunction at the next required APK inspection.
Stop immediately. Continuing to drive can lead to serious damage to the car.
sorular.dogruCevap: Keep driving until you can safely stop and call the garage or breakdown service.

feedback.metin: If the "engine management malfunction" warning light comes on, it is wise to call the garage or breakdown service. If the vehicle still drives normally and the light is orange, not red, you do not have to stop immediately. Calmly drive to a safe place and stop the vehicle. If you notice that the vehicle loses power or functions poorly in any way, it is wise to stop immediately.

sorular.soru: Do you have to give right of way to the pedestrian?

feedback.metin: The pedestrian is continuing on the same road you are driving on and want to turn off of. Through traffic has right of way over traffic turning off, so you must give right of way to the pedestrian.

sorular.soru: Do you have to give right of way to the pedestrian?

feedback.metin: You are leaving a 30 km zone, where the road is not laid out as an entrance or exit construction. You are not required to give right of way to pedestrians coming from the left or the right. Pedestrians are not drivers.

sorular.soru: Should you give right of way to the pedestrian?

feedback.metin: The pedestrian is continuing traffic on the same road that you want to turn off of. Continuing traffic on the same road has right of way over traffic leaving the road by turning left or right. The pedestrian has right of way.

sorular.soru: How many tracks does a level crossing with this sign have?

feedback.metin: This double cross indicates a level crossing with two or more tracks. A single cross indicates a level crossing with a single track.

sorular.soru: Where can you wait for passengers?

feedback.metin: Waiting for passengers falls under parking according to the law. Parking is allowed at the E-8 sign. At the E-7 sign you are only allowed to load or unload goods, or pick up or drop off a passenger.

sorular.soru: Is it wise to replace a child restraint system after a collision?

feedback.metin: The protective effect of a child restraint system decreases considerably if it has already provided protection in the event of an accident. Always replace the child restraint system after an accident.

sorular.soru: After which sign should you expect oncoming traffic?

feedback.metin: Sign D-4 indicates a mandatory direction of travel at an intersection or junction. This is not the same as a one-way street. The sign means that drivers at the intersection have to follow the direction indicated on the sign and are not allowed to turn off in this case. In situation A this does not apply to cyclists and moped riders. However, in both situations, you should expect oncoming traffic.

sorular.soru: What should you take into account if you overtake on the right here?
cevaplar: That you must give right of way to exiting drivers.
That other drivers are not expecting to be overtaken on the right.
That this is only allowed when there are no arrows on the road surface.
sorular.dogruCevap: That other drivers are not expecting to be overtaken on the right.

feedback.metin: It is not always safe to overtake on the right-hand side of a block marking. For example, many drivers are not expecting to be overtaken on the right. Should such a driver make a last-minute decision to exit the motorway, there is a good chance they may not see you.

sorular.soru: When should a trailer be fitted with front and rear marker lights?
cevaplar: When the trailer is wider than 1.55 metres.
When the trailer is wider than 1.75 metres.
When the trailer is wider than 2.10 metres.
sorular.dogruCevap: When the trailer is wider than 2.10 metres.

feedback.metin: If a trailer or caravan is wider than 2.10 metres, it must be fitted with two white marker lights on the front and two red marker lights on the rear. These marker lights emphasise the width of the trailer or caravan.

sorular.soru: Is it dangerous to wear the seat belt under your armpit instead of over your shoulder?
cevaplar: Only if the vehicle also has no airbags.
No. This is even necessary if it is otherwise too close to the neck.
Yes. This greatly decreases the effectiveness of the belt.
sorular.dogruCevap: Yes. This greatly decreases the effectiveness of the belt.

feedback.metin: A three-point seat belt only works well if it is worn correctly. This means that the seat belt is tight across the hip and strapped across the shoulder, not too close to the neck. If the seat belt is not positioned correctly, it needs to be adjusted. The effectiveness of the belt decreases considerably if it is not worn correctly, such as under the armpit, or even only as a lap belt. Whether or not a vehicle has airbags does not matter in this case, because also the airbags only work well if you wear the belt correctly.

sorular.soru: Can you drive here?

feedback.metin: This road is closed to motor vehicles with trailers.

sorular.soru: Is it safe to overtake this snorfiets rider here?

feedback.metin: Overtaking at an intersection is only prohibited when doing so results in a dangerous situation. Overtaking at intersections where the flow of traffic is unclear is therefore prohibited. This is a reasonably well-organised intersection, and you do not have to give right of way to anyone because you are driving on a priority road. However, you must take into account the possibility of snorfiets riders turning off without checking over their shoulder. In this situation, it is therefore wise to stay behind the snorfiets rider until you have passed the intersection.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to drive on?
cevaplar: Yes. But you can only turn left.
No. You are not allowed to drive.
Yes. But you can only turn right.
sorular.dogruCevap: No. You are not allowed to drive.

feedback.metin: The traffic controller is giving a stop sign for the traffic approaching him from the front. You are not allowed to drive.

sorular.soru: Can you drop off a passenger here?

feedback.metin: You are not allowed to wait next to a solid yellow line, so you cannot wait or stop to pick up or drop off a passenger, or load or unload goods.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to drive like this?

feedback.metin: The windscreen and the front side windows must not be damaged or discoloured. You are not allowed to drive like this.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to stop here to load and unload goods?

feedback.metin: In an erf, you may only park in designated parking spaces. Loading and unloading goods are not categorised as parking and is therefore allowed here. Furthermore, you are not inconveniencing any other road users.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to turn left here?

feedback.metin: The C-4 sign indicates that you may only drive on the road you are approaching in the direction indicated by the arrow. However, the bottom sign indicates that this sign only applies to lorries and buses. All other drivers, including you, are allowed to turn left here.

sorular.soru: Are salvage company motor vehicles also emergency vehicles?

feedback.metin: Salvage company motor vehicles are not emergency vehicles. They do not use blue flashing or blinking lights and do not have a two-tone horn, unlike the police and the fire brigade. Drivers of motor vehicles that have been officially designated to carry out work such as towing or hoisting may use yellow flashing or blinking lights. If necessary, they may also use the hard shoulder in order to reach the scene of an accident more quickly and clear the road.

sorular.soru: What is the best way to position your front wheels when waiting to make a left turn?

feedback.metin: If you have to wait on a carriageway before turning left, you are advised to position your wheels facing straight ahead. This is the safest option. If your wheels are facing the direction you intend to turn, and you are hit from behind by another vehicle, you will be pushed forward into oncoming traffic. Turning the wheels in the opposite direction does not ensure your safety.

sorular.soru: Can a supplementary plate be placed below a traffic sign to provide a more detailed explanation?

feedback.metin: Supplementary plates placed below traffic signs provide a more detailed explanation. For example, it can indicate the nature of the danger or for whom or when the sign does or does not apply.

sorular.soru: Who is allowed to use the right-most lane?

feedback.metin: This lane may only be used by public bus drivers. If the matrix sign shows the word BUS, coach drivers may also use this lane.

sorular.soru: What should you do if this is on the carriageway of a motorway?
cevaplar: Stop and clean up the stones.

feedback.metin: If you see something dangerous on the carriageway of a motorway, call 112 as soon as possible. Report the place and the location as accurately as possible. Under no circumstances should you clean it up yourself. This puts yourself in danger.

sorular.soru: The train has passed. Is driving onwards allowed?

feedback.metin: Only when the red light is off, you may cross the level crossing. You can see by the double Andreas cross that the level crossing consists of two or more tracks. After a train has passed, a second train can also come from the opposite direction.
